verses.verse: For all this I considered <WH5414> <WH8804> in my heart <WH3820> even to declare <WH952> <WH8800> all this, that the righteous <WH6662>, and the wise <WH2450>, and their works <WH5652>, are in the hand <WH3027> of 'Elohim <WH430>: no man <WH120> knoweth <WH3045> <WH8802> either <WH1571> love <WH160> or hatred <WH8135> by all that is before <WH6440> them.

All things come alike to all: there is one <WH259> event <WH4745> to the righteous <WH6662>, and to the wicked <WH7563>; to the good <WH2896> and to the clean <WH2889>, and to the unclean <WH2931>; to him that sacrificeth <WH2076> <WH8802>, and to him that <WH834> sacrificeth <WH2076> <WH8802> not: as is the good <WH2896>, so is the sinner <WH2398> <WH8802>; and he that sweareth <WH7650> <WH8737>, as he that feareth <WH3373> an oath <WH7621>.

This is an evil <WH7451> among all things that are done <WH6213> <WH8738> under the sun <WH8121>, that there is one <WH259> event <WH4745> unto all: yea, also the heart <WH3820> of the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> is full <WH4390> <WH8804> of evil <WH7451>, and madness <WH1947> is in their heart <WH3824> while they live <WH2416>, and after <WH310> that they go to the dead <WH4191> <WH8801>.

For <WH4310> to him that is <WH3426> joined <WH2266> <WH8792> <WH8675> <WH977> <WH8792> to all the living <WH2416> there is hope <WH986>: for a living <WH2416> dog <WH3611> is better <WH2896> than a dead <WH4191> <WH8801> lion <WH738>.

For the living <WH2416> know <WH3045> <WH8802> that they shall die <WH4191> <WH8799>: but the dead <WH4191> <WH8801> know <WH3045> <WH8802> not any thing <WH3972>, neither have they any more a reward <WH7939>; for the memory <WH2143> of them is forgotten <WH7911> <WH8738>.

Also their love <WH160>, and their hatred <WH8135>, and their envy <WH7068>, is now <WH3528> perished <WH6> <WH8804>; neither have they any more a portion <WH2506> for ever <WH5769> in any thing that is done <WH6213> <WH8738> under the sun <WH8121>.

Go thy way <WH3212> <WH8798>, eat <WH398> <WH8798> thy bread <WH3899> with joy <WH8057>, and drink <WH8354> <WH8798> thy wine <WH3196> with a merry <WH2896> heart <WH3820>; for 'Elohim <WH430> now <WH3528> accepteth <WH7521> <WH8804> thy works <WH4639>.
Let thy garments <WH899> be always <WH6256> white <WH3836>; and let thy head <WH7218> lack <WH2637> <WH8799> no ointment <WH8081>.

Live <WH2416> joyfully <WH7200> <WH8798> with the wife <WH802> whom thou lovest <WH157> <WH8804> all the days <WH3117> of the life <WH2416> of thy vanity <WH1892>, which he hath given <WH5414> <WH8804> thee under the sun <WH8121>, all the days <WH3117> of thy vanity <WH1892>: for that is thy portion <WH2506> in this life <WH2416>, and in thy labour <WH5999> which thou takest <WH6001> under the sun <WH8121>.

Whatsoever thy hand <WH3027> findeth <WH4672> <WH8799> to do <WH6213> <WH8800>, do <WH6213> <WH8798> it with thy might <WH3581>; for there is no work <WH4639>, nor device <WH2808>, nor knowledge <WH1847>, nor wisdom <WH2451>, in the grave <WH7585>, whither thou goest <WH1980> <WH8802>.

I returned <WH7725> <WH8804>, and saw <WH7200> <WH8800> under the sun <WH8121>, that the race <WH4793> is not to the swift <WH7031>, nor the battle <WH4421> to the strong <WH1368>, neither yet bread <WH3899> to the wise <WH2450>, nor yet riches <WH6239> to men of understanding <WH995> <WH8737>, nor yet favour <WH2580> to men of skill <WH3045> <WH8802>; but time <WH6256> and chance <WH6294> happeneth <WH7136> <WH8799> to them all.

For man <WH120> also knoweth <WH3045> <WH8799> not his time <WH6256>: as the fishes <WH1709> that are taken <WH270> <WH8737> in an evil <WH7451> net <WH4685>, and as the birds <WH6833> that are caught <WH270> <WH8803> in the snare <WH6341>; so <WH1992> are the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> snared <WH3369> <WH8795> in an evil <WH7451> time <WH6256>, when it falleth <WH5307> <WH8799> suddenly <WH6597> upon them.
This <WH2090> wisdom <WH2451> have I seen <WH7200> <WH8804> also under the sun <WH8121>, and it seemed great <WH1419> unto me:

There was a little <WH6996> city <WH5892>, and few <WH4592> men <WH582> within it; and there came <WH935> <WH8804> a great <WH1419> king <WH4428> against it, and besieged <WH5437> <WH8804> it, and built <WH1129> <WH8804> great <WH1419> bulwarks <WH4685> against it:

Now there was found <WH4672> <WH8804> in it a poor <WH4542> wise <WH2450> man <WH376>, and he by his wisdom <WH2451> delivered <WH4422> <WH8765> the city <WH5892>; yet no man <WH120> remembered <WH2142> <WH8804> that same poor <WH4542> man <WH376>.

Then said <WH559> <WH8804> I, Wisdom <WH2451> is better <WH2896> than strength <WH1369>: nevertheless the poor man's <WH4542> wisdom <WH2451> is despised <WH959> <WH8803>, and his words <WH1697> are not heard <WH8085> <WH8737>.
The words <WH1697> of wise <WH2450> men are heard <WH8085> <WH8737> in quiet <WH5183> more than the cry <WH2201> of him that ruleth <WH4910> <WH8802> among fools <WH3684>.
Wisdom <WH2451> is better <WH2896> than weapons <WH3627> of war <WH7128>: but one <WH259> sinner <WH2398> <WH8802> destroyeth <WH6> <WH8762> much <WH7235> <WH8687> good <WH2896>.
